front.title: Ethernet Traffic Parameters with Availability Information

abstract.t: A packet switching network may contain links with variable bandwidth, e.g., copper, radio, etc. The bandwidth of such links is sensitive to external environment. Availability is typically used for describing the link during network planning. This document introduces an optional Availability TLV in Resource ReSerVation Protocol - Traffic Engineer (RSVP-TE) signaling. This extension can be used to set up a Generalized Multi-Protocol Label Switching (GMPLS) Label Switched Path (LSP) using the Ethernet SENDER_TSPEC object.
